Key Match Events: Davis Martin struck out four and walked five over 3 2/3 innings in his final start of the season.
Andrew Benintendi’s one-out single in the 10th inning scored Miguel Vargas, resulting in a walk-off victory.
Luis Robert Jr. contributed with two doubles in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Davis Martin commented on the season, stating, 'No one likes losing. Winning is a lot more fun.'
Grady Sizemore emphasized the importance of building on the recent wins and maintaining consistency.
Andrew Benintendi expressed the team's desire to make the most out of the remaining games.
Luis Robert Jr. reflected on his statistical drop-off this season and its impact on the team.
Davis Martin mentioned the team's goal to spoil games for Detroit in their upcoming series.
Grady Sizemore highlighted the competitive nature of the upcoming series against Detroit, who are fighting for a playoff spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox avoided becoming the first team in baseball history to lose 60 games at home in one season.
The White Sox won their fourth straight home game and second straight home series.
